document_data.name: Dwarven waraxe
document_data.mainbody: The '''dwarven waraxe''' was a type of [[axe]] unique to the [[dwarf|dwarven]] people<ref> and was thus considered by other races to be among the more unusual weapons utilized by them.
document_data.Description: The dwarven waraxe was a single-bladed axe, larger and heavier than a [[battleaxe]], but less so than the double-bladed [[greataxe]]. The average dwarven waraxe weighed around {{SI|8|lbs.|k}}.
document_data.Weaponology: It required special training to use a dwarven waraxe one-handed, due to its size.
document_data.Notable Dwarven Waraxes:
* [[Blood Frenzy (axe)|''Blood Frenzy'']], a dwarven waraxe that was [[enchanted]] to be especially effective against [[orc]]s.
* ''[[Dwarven bloodstone blade]]'', enchanted dwarven waraxes that were decorated with [[bloodstone]]s.

Notable Users.Groups: * The dwarves created by the [[deepspawn]] [[Hukurus]] typically wielded dwarven waraxes against their enemies.<ref>
Notable Users.Individuals:
* [[Dorn Crownshield]], a dwarven [[mercenary]] in [[Melvaunt]].
* [[Drusulai]], a [[half-celestial]] dwarven [[paladin]] of [[Moradin]], wielded a dwarven waraxe that was blessed by [[Pistis Sophia]].<ref>
* [[Glynt Axefist]], a [[gold dwarf]] mercenary, wielded a masterwork dwarven waraxe.
* [[Gyudd]], a dwarven distiller in [[Skullport]], carried around a dwarven waraxe.<ref>
* [[Gwendar Dolmenward]], a gold dwarf mercenary, wielded a masterwork dwarven waraxe.
* [[Harbromm]], the King of [[Citadel Adbar]], carried a dwarven waraxe enchanted with ''+3 [[flaming burst]]''.
Notable Users.Races & Sentient Creatures: * Among the dwarves subraces of [[Toril]] the dwarven waraxe was typically utilized by gold dwarves, [[shield dwarves]], and [[urdunnirin]].
